meanings.definition: A mark or sign of a path or route.
meanings.sent1: The traiks on the map guided us through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I followed the traiks of footprints in the snow to find my way back.
meanings.sent3: The traiks on the treasure map led to a surprise birthday party!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter left a traiks of joy in everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The traiks of history can be seen in the ancient ruins.

meanings.definition: To follow or pursue someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I traiks my dog as he chases after the ball.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to traiks the suspect discreetly.
meanings.sent3: The cat traiks the laser pointer around the room with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams traiks her to far-off lands in her sleep.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh cookies traiks me to the kitchen every time.

meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I traiks up the stairs to my bed.
meanings.sent2: The old dog traiks behind his owner on their evening walk.
meanings.sent3: The snail traiks along the garden path at its own pace.
meanings.sent4: Time traiks on when you're waiting for something exciting.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker traiks through the last stretch of the trail.
